new_items.example_en: A munificent benefactor funded the new library.
new_items.example_zh: 一位慷慨的捐助者資助了新圖書館。
new_items.label: new

new_items.example_en: The professor's polemical article sparked a campus-wide debate.
new_items.example_zh: 那位教授充滿爭議的文章引發了全校的辯論。
new_items.label: new

new_items.example_en: His jejune arguments were quickly dismissed by the panel.
new_items.example_zh: 他天真膚淺的論點很快就被專家小組駁回了。
new_items.label: new

new_items.en_definition: obedient or attentive to an excessive or servile degree
new_items.example_en: The obsequious assistant anticipated his boss's every need.
new_items.example_zh: 那個諂媚的助理預判了老闆的每一個需求。
new_items.label: new

new_items.en_definition: eager or quick to argue, quarrel, or fight
new_items.example_en: The pugnacious politician was known for his aggressive debate style.
new_items.example_zh: 這位好鬥的政治人物以其攻擊性的辯論風格聞名。
new_items.label: new

new_items.en_definition: having keen mental discernment and good judgment; wise
new_items.example_en: The sagacious leader's advice was sought by many.
new_items.example_zh: 許多人都向那位睿智的領導者尋求建議。
new_items.label: new

new_items.example_en: The old house was redolent of his childhood memories.
new_items.example_zh: 那棟老房子讓他強烈地回憶起童年。
new_items.label: new

new_items.example_en: Her pellucid writing style made complex ideas accessible.
new_items.example_zh: 她清晰的寫作風格讓複雜的概念變得淺顯易懂。
new_items.label: new
